snippet: The benefits of homeownership are cited repeatedly in justifying the tax breaks given to home buyers. But a study has tied homeownership with rising levels of unemployment.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column highlights study by economists David G Blanchflower and Andrew J Oswald finding that rising levels of homeownership can be precursor to sharp rises in unemployment;  warns that findings could be misconstrued and used to pass dangerous legislation limiting time-tested tax breaks for home buyers.
lead_paragraph: The benefits of homeownership are cited repeatedly in justifying the tax breaks given to home buyers. But a study has tied homeownership with rising levels of unemployment.

headline.print_headline: Challenge To Dogma On Owning A Home
headline.main: Challenge to Dogma on Owning a Home
